intro: Galium maritimum var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in maritime environments. This variant is distinguished by its narrower foliage compared to the typical form of Galium maritimum.
